intro: Urostachys trachyloma, commonly known as the mountain pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, giving it a unique appearance. Urostachys trachyloma is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental qualities as well as its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
